page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: As part of the work on the Domesday Survey local residents were interviewed to find out any details about their area. The most interesting details came from an old age pensioner who lived very near to Chancellors School.She told us that the lake in that area had been there for over 100 years. The lake was part of the grounds of a stately home. The house was burned down and its grounds are now part of the golf course.The lady said she could not believe the day that the council dug a trench alongside her house leading to the lake. The lake was full of tench and these were now put in danger.The lady s son and his friends moved the tench from the lake to Queenswod. They put hundreds of tench in there and carried them all in buckets.
